acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 48-hour EC50>500mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (SIDS, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: There is rabbit trial report (IUCLID (2000)), and all are in the range of 2100 - 3600 mg/kg. So it is classified into Category 5.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There is rat test (IUCLID (2000)), and the calculated value converted into ppm of 4 hour inhalation was about 1100ppm. So it was classified as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 5 based on SPECIES: Rat; VALUE: 4263mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: IUCLID (2000)

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is a report that carcinogenic is not seen in the tests using rats, hamsters, and mice (SIDS (2001)). Moreover, since ACGIH has classified into A4 (Not Classifiable as a Human Calcinogen), it carries out the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (water solubility=1.00*106mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 4 because of its flash point: 63degC (SIDS, 2001)

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Increase of the chromosomal aberrations was not acknowledged in the survey for the workers (SIDS (2001)). Moreover, because we found negative data in some in vivo examinations, such as the dominant lethality examination using the rat and the mouse, and the chromosomal aberration test of rat marrow (SIDS (2001)), we classified it as Out Of Category.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 400 degC and does not ignite spontaneously in normal temperatures.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It is classified into category 1B since that abnormalities are observed of fetal organ and skeletal formation in the rabbit study in the pregnant mother administered orally through drinking waters or nasogastric tubes (SIDS (2001), ACGIH (2001)), and  abnormalities are obaserved of fetal organ and skeletal formation as same in pregnant maternal inhalation exposure  (SIDS (2001)), moreover,  EU has classified into the reproduction Category 2 (damage may be occur to a fetus).

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: We have no data and we could not classify it.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It is considered as "slightly irritating" in humans, but indicating "mild" and reversible irritation in the almost tests using rabbits, it is classified into Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Although it is considered to have no stimulativeness on humans (SIDS (2001)), results of having mild irritation (RTECS (2004)) or no stimulativeness (SIDS (2001)) are obtained with rabbits. The results on guinea pigs is severe irritation, and on mice is slight to no stimulativeness depending on doses (SIDS (2001)). These data is synthesized, and it was judged to have mild irritation. So it was classified as Category 3.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: We classified it as Out Of Category according to the description that it has no sensitizing property for human and guinea pigs (SIDS (2001), PATTY (2001)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on that dysfunction of the liver is observed in the worker engaged in the workplace treating DMA for a long-term period (ACGIH (2001)), hypertrophy liver is observed in the inhalation exposure test using a rat within the range of the guidance value of Category 2 (SIDS (2001), ACGIH (2001)), and the effects on the liver is observed in the inhalation study using a mouse within the range of the guidance value of Category 2 (PATTY (2004)), experience with humans is considerd seriously and it is classified into Category 1 (target organ: liver).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is a report that it has an effect on liver within the limits of the inhalation exposure guidance value to Category 1 in mammalians whose animal species is not specified (RTECS (2004)). However, the data is inadequate as a reason for classification. Classified into Category 3 (anesthetic action) because it is regarded as inducing giddiness, lethargy and frailty in humans (ACGIH (2001)).
